ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Problem Signing On/Staying On
ygData.msgSnippet: I use AOL when I am not at my brothers playing.  I can play just fine, sometimes it takes me a few different numbers until I get one with a good connection
ygData.messageBody:
I use AOL when I am not at my brothers playing. I can play just fine,
sometimes it takes me a few different numbers until I get one with a good
connection that day I just use DOS and tracert to see if its a good # that
day. I cant do hate with AOL though, all those people in that one small
room I just cant stay connected.

Mu
-----Original Message-----
From: Su [mailto:suceress@...]
Sent: Saturday, May 26, 2001 12:40 AM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Problem Signing On/Staying On



I had that problem for awhile and it turned out it was my modem. then it
turned out my phonelines were getting feedback from my power backup unit...
So it was disrupting my connection.
Also, if they have a firewall up it will interfere.
AOL users can kiss their money and time goodbye bc EQ hardly works from what
I've heard.
luv,
-Su

> Update Drivers, Video and Audio.
> Close all programs running in background. (I have to do this with my PC)
>
> Cant think of anything else.
>
> Mu
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: John_Miewald@...
> [mailto:John_Miewald@...]

> Subject: [EverQuest] Problem Signing On/Staying On
>

>
> I have a friend who is having an unusually difficult time signing on and
> staying online. It seems that just about any time she zones, you can
> assume she will not be on anymore.
>
> Is this a common problem? Does anyone have some "quick fix" ideas that
> might keep her from being punted so easily?
>
> Thanks for any help.
>
> "Alazais"
